Reviews.Title: “old and filthy hotel”
Reviews.Author: GMI54
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely horrible! The accomodation was that run down, that even rainwater from the roof trickled into my room. Though having claimed immediately the managing director did no efforts for a room change. Furthermore the shower in the bathroom was full of mildew! I never will sleep here again!

Reviews.Title: “NICE BUT NEDD IMPROVE”
Reviews.Author: Srithaikrailassiri
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Garden Hotel. we were happy our trip in Singapore . We stayed here is the second hotel.that one not really good as we expected but for us we think OK. One thing we did not like at this hotel , We felt the room very old and all sheets and pillows are so old and Long time been used. We hope net time come back the hotel will be changed much and have a lot of customers. The hotel is pig but service need improve Swimming pool is nice and the price is suitable not very high for the room.

Reviews.Title: “The end of the Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillSB
Reviews.Content: The Garden Hotel will soon be no more. At the end of January 2010 The Garden Hotel in Balmoral Road is right now being demolished. Don`t know what future plans are - but it is certainly under the big hammer.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: DavidMarkH
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Garden Hotel in the 1990s and in the early part of 2000. At that time is was good value for money and fairly comfortable. When I stayed there in March 2006, it was an awful experience. The breakfast was the worst buffet that I have evey had and I mean ever. I was visiting family, so I would get up in the morning and not return until late at night. The carpet in the room was stained and old. I did not like walking on it in my bare feet ... The staff were polite but you could see they were used to people complaining.The pool was actually green with alge I do not think it was safe to swim in. I love to swim so this was a big dissapointment to me. I was only in the hotel for 2 days and I had paid upfront so stuck it out.I left the hotel feeling depressed and looking forward to getting home. There are some lovely hotel in Singapore so its a shame that this one was in such a state.

Reviews.Title: “stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Taniath
Reviews.Content: Just stay away. I spent 7 days there and would have shifted hotels if I hadn't pre-paid- other tourists with me left for the YMCA after 1 night. I had to wait 2 hours for my room to be ready and I got to the hotel at 10am! They told me to enjoy a beakfast while waiting, which I did, then was charged full price for. The room was dark, dingy and not worth (then) $80 a night, and it's a hike to Orchard Rd past the lovely Goodwood Park (which I should have stayed at). One night I ordered a bland room service and the used dishes and tray sat outside my room for FOUR days! The front desk staff were supremely unhelpful during check in and at check out wanted to slug me with $5 SGD 'connection' fees when I called home (and no-one picked up). I refused, and it shaved a good $50 SGD off my phone bill. Stay somewhere better like the Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant experience!”
Reviews.Author: apucca
Reviews.Content: I was terribly upset with the services, the room, the breakfast and everything about it. I booked for a king size bed but when I checked-in, they gave me a twin bedroom instead because they were out of king beds, REFUSED to do anything about and they were rude. My stay was prepaid so I couldn't back out otherwise it will be forfeited. Bellboy actually "waited" by our door for us to tip him before he left. Breakfast was awful, it looked like food served at a camp site. Room was old and smelly. This hotel is definitely the worst hotel services without a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Wasted money”
Reviews.Author: seena9
Reviews.Content: Garden hotel is dirty and smelly, there is a musty horrible smell on entering this hotel and the smell didn't get any better working our way up from the lifts, to the room. The hallway has a lot of water damage to the walls and carpets which are in total disrepair, I guess this is responsible for a lot of the musty smell. The curtains are filthy and the one chair in the room was filthy as was the carpet and cockroaches in the bathroom, fortunately the sheets looked ok. This is a standard I would expect in a third world country for around $30.00 a night not SINGAPORE. S$180.00 per night for the type of accommodation offered is extremely overpriced. My mind boggles at what I would get for $100.00 in Singapore. I didn't know this standard existed in Singapore. On a brighter note the bell boy was very friendly and helpful and the ladies behind the reception were polite.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in Singapore-for its price.”
Reviews.Author: Gaspmich
Reviews.Content: Dirty stained carpets.Drippy ceilings. Literally Canned Meat Loaf and powdered orange juice in disposable plastic cups for breakfast.The coffee shop looks depressing. In a residential location that's far from the MRT or any decent shopping center. Old TV sets and phones that don't work.Bedsheets that smell weird. Lousy service. I requested for an adaptor that never arrived. You have to be desperate to stay here. There are cheaper and better hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Smelling Hotel, Dirty Carperts, Uncourteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: Uksal
Reviews.Content: 1) Hotel Corridors Carpets and Hygiene need attention. 2) Rooms not properly lit. Most of the fittings either out of order and not maintained properly.Electrical Sockets for making tea etc. found not functional. 3) We had checked out of the room No. 302 on the noon of 7th June, 2007, as per their advice whereas our return flight was at 11.00 PM. They had assured that assistance would be provided for change over in the evening prior to leaving for Airport late in the evening since your driver was suppossed to pick us up from the Hotel at 8.00 PM. On our return from the Market after shopping we were told to either shift the luggage, which was handed over to the security in the morning at about 10.30, to take the same to the fifth floor outselves and do unpacking/packing there or on the ground floor, near the Bar on the ground floor. The bar incharge, an elderably gentleman of about 50 years of age, told us to complete the packing/unpacking within 5/6 minutes and leave the corridor. With great difficulty, we were able to shift the luggage from near the front office to the Corridor near the Bar and complete the process in about 10 minutes. The Bar Incharge was very sarcastic and made uncalled for racist remarks about Indian Standard Time and punctuality. Another assistance of the Bar Incharge wanted us to carry the Heavy weight trolley and luggage outselves from Front office to the Corridor without appreciating the fact that both me and wife are aged around 57 and 65 years of age and I being a Heart Patient with a Stent carrying in my both had clear instructions from the Doctor not to carry heavy weight at all was put to lot of inconvenience by the Bar Incharge and his assistant.

Reviews.Title: “Jaded but still good.”
Reviews.Author: ricklangley
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Garden Hotel. The first was ten years ago and the old place hasn't changed much! The taxi driver told me that it was one of the swishest hotels in Singapore when it first opened, which I would guess would have been in the sixties. It's one of those slightly sad hotels that was obviously top of the range once, but hasn't had any money spent on it since the day it opened. Having said that, it's pleasant enough and I would be very happy to stay there again. My room was an excellent size and had a nice view overlooking the swimming pool. The staff were very friendly and efficient. Given the low price (£28) I paid for my one night stopover, I was surprised to find that a very good buffet breakfast was included. The location is a little bit away from the major hotels in downtown and from Orchard Road, but in a pleasant and quiet residential area. Transport is really no problem as there is an MTR station about ten minutes walk away, or alternatively, taxis in Singapore are inexpensive. I'd definitely recommend the Garden. It's got everything I would want at a third of the price or less, of the big name places in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sretsam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Garden on our way home from 2 months backpacking around Eastern Europe. I agree with some of the comments made in the previous review. The hotel looked like a 'throw-back' to the early 90's. The carpet in the halls was not great and the furnishings looked as though they had seen much better days. BUT we enjoyed our stay. The rooms were big, the staff very friendly and the breakfast choice was basic but huge. It included 3 types of cereal, toast, pasteries,fruit, baked beans, eggs, hash browns, sausages, fried rice or a noodle dish, tea, coffee, 2 types of juice. Considering the price and the closeness to Orchard road, this hotel is okay. If you like a hotel that has staff to do everything for you, including opening doors, then is not the hotel you should choose. But if you like to have your own space but be able to access satff as you need them, then this is just the place. We also enjoyed the roof top pool, which was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but...”
Reviews.Author: timtehkl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 15 and 16 July 2006. NO creepy crawlies BUT the furniture pieces were old..there was a MUSTY smell..had to buy a can of spray to spray the room..even then...the smell was there...breakfast was okay but limited choices...all in all...not worth the money i paid for...i rather pay more and get a better hotel. Dr. Teh Chee Seng kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

Reviews.Title: “Falling apart”
Reviews.Author: kiraywm
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this hotel considering it is rated 3 stars. Then again it is self rated :P The hotel is falling apart with water dripping from the ceiling, the carpeting obviously needs to be replaced as it is worn out and stained from all the wetness. I have my doubts as to whether the rooms have ever been vacuumed properly, as I suspect the cleaners just change the sheets and replace items in the bathroom, as well as removing any -obvious- eyesores like hair. I was astounded with the lack of management in the hotel. One room on the 4th floor had finished room-service food left outside its door, but it was untouched during the 4 days I stayed there. Shows how grotty the food and service there is! i give them credit for the buffet as it really was indeed nice food. BUT on my last day at the hotel, they ran out of food for the buffet breakfast! The cook had to come out to the dining area himself and bring out more bread, fruits etc, which was just hidden behind a counter. Why did the waiters and waitresses not bring it out themselves?? then the cook had to go back inside and fry up some rice for the 10's of ppl who had just arrived to see empty plates of food. Truly terrible hotel, you can do better!

Reviews.Title: “It was fine!!!”
Reviews.Author: harleybouy
Reviews.Content: Garden Hotel Singapore, Aug – Sept 2006. I was concerned after booking the Hotel and then reading the reviews. They painted a very bad picture and I started to worry. On reaching the Hotel I was asked if I would like a smoking or non smoking room. That was a good start. I chose non smoking and went to the room. The room was clean and didn’t smell. I received fresh linen every day and the bed was comfortable and quiet. Sure the staff could have smiled more but so could I. I was there 10 nights and the breakfasts did get a bit boring, but it was included in the price. The roof pool was clean and quiet and often we were the only people there. We ate out all lunches and most dinners, but what we had in the Hotel was great and reasonably priced. For the people who wrote the bad reviews, you obviously have way to much time and nothing better to do. Suck it up Stop [--]. The staff were accommodating and the hourly shuttle was 5 minutes to the CBD, or 15 minutes walk to Orchard Road Shops. The driver was friendly and helpful. We had a great stay and will stay again. As a Chinese Taxi river told me, “When the Garden Hotel was opened some thirty years ago it was the best hotel in Singapore”. Sure it could do with a renovation but it does very well and seemed very busy. We went on Holiday to SINGAPORE not the hotel. No rodents, bed bug infestations or cockroaches. Thankyou to Management and Staff. David Stark, Perth, Western Australia.

Reviews.Title: “No the best”
Reviews.Author: Zzoiks
Reviews.Content: This is an ok enough place if you just need to sleep somewhere for a night or two and don't want to pay a lot for it. For longer periods or special ocassions (I was there for Christmas- a mistake) you're better off paying a bit more for a better place. Yes, during the 2 weeks I was there there were a few cockroaches. Whole place smelled musty/funny but I put it down to carpeting and general humid funk. Carpets in room and in hallway suffering from mildew (to be expected in that kind of constant humidity...really what is anyone thinking having carpeting in a climate like singapore where mould is to be expected on everything!?) If you order room service they don't tend to pick up plates etc until next day (perhaps helping to attract the cockroaches). I needed to see a doctor during my stay and asked at the front desk for advice/assistance as to how to do that (as the card in the room advises you to do) but the clerk didn't have any idea how to help me (eventually sorted it out on my own, but could have used the help). Air conditioning makes room too cold (not very good variable settings) and not having it on makes it too uncomfortable. TV only has about 3 (dull) stations and no in-room movies as it written. In two weeks never encountered this mysterious courtyard pool they mention, the rooftop one is small and a bit dirty but passable. Exercise room is a joke- two or three broken pieces of equipment in a stifling shoebox of a room on the roof. This shopping arcade they mention is a bit of a mystery too. Atrium breakfast area somewhat dirty, plastic lawn chairs for furniture and wobbly tables, same food every day but it is edible..... Cleaning ladies quite smiley and nice, but slow. I get the feeling that the bedspread was not changed between guests, which is a bit creepy-although sheets were changed for me. Carpets were not hoovered during my stay- didnt like that as floor was dirty. Bathroom ok and water pressure in shower good (if you have long hair this is a consideration).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: JenMlaPhil
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the "cockroach scare", me and my sister never saw one in our room or in any part of the hotel. The hotel looks old with old-fashioned curtains but it's generally clean and cozy. We appreciate the concierge, the dining crew for attending to our endless queries. You guys definitely gave us a very good impression of Singapore. Definitely, our next trip there will again be spent in Garden Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “thoughts on Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hilarie
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Garden Hotel in Singapore with friends, despite the worrying review of some travellers to this hotel. The hotel indeed does need updating, but offers good value for money. Our room had clean sheets and clean towels. We found the staff very helpful. We found no cockroaches in our room - there was one in the hallway however. Would revisit.

Reviews.Title: “For Cockroach Enthusiasts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you like cockroaches then this is the hotel for you – We swapped from one room to another and so on and only to find more and more crispy crawlers. Avoid this place! A shabby, mouldy, dirty and smelly experience – No wonder though, they are tearing it down very soon!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: LivertC
Reviews.Content: Checking was smooth on a Friday, but a request for a late checkout on Sunday was denied, as the hotel was fully booked for the weekend. I requested a room facing the garden, but only the ground floor units were available, meanining that anyone having meals in the cafe would be able to see you go in and out of your room. There is not much of a view from the ground floor, even though there was a slight elevation. Our standard deluxe room had rattan furniture, (online photos showed better furniture :( ) the sheets were clean, Although websites showed a hairdrier as part of the in-room facilitires, there wasn't one in our room. It is a 12 minute *brisk* walk to the Newton MRT station (not advisable during warm/sunny weather) The shuttle service from the hotel is good, (it departs every hour to Orchard Road) Breakfast was simple, but sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: mivyk
Reviews.Content: garden hotel was a very unfriendly place. we were told to wait for more than an hour because the reservation officer was having lunch and we were not on the list. we were very tired from a long flight. when i got mad, that's the time they called the reservation officer. the room was not clean and with foul smell. they will lend hair dryer at 7am, not earlier. breakfast is served 7am and sometimes past 7am already. we were at the hotel for 5 nights and breakfast was the same all throughout our stay. they only have 1 fruit in the buffet, watermelon! staff were very, very unfriendly. they would frown at you even with a slightest request such as clear out your table. moreover, you cannot walk around the hotel since it's far from the busy district. their facilities look ancient. pool was not clean, and no more light at 8pm. terrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I hate it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing! Not value for money! The room is dark and wet, carpet and blankets full of fleas, air conditioning not working; dirty floors; poor food quality breakfast; staff with terrible working attitude - not customer-oriented. I will never consider staying in this hotel again. It's terrible.

Reviews.Title: “economy hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed this hotel on March 5-7,05 , this is economy hotel which is good for people who need to avoid the noisy location, although a little bit far fm the public transportation but hotel still provide the shuttle bus which is more convience. Services is ok but the airconditioning vent is full of fluff which suppose should be proper cleaned. Overall is ok and good as the room rate and location.

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the garden is very close to orchard road and in the middle of everything but the hotel it self was not greastest. if you want good value and want to be near by to everything this is the hotel for you. but u dont go away to just stay in the hotel do you.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointing, reviews pictures and information about this hotel were all misleading and inaccurate. We could not get out of this hotel fast enough. Room had a very strong mildew odour and was badly water damaged. Carpets were torn, airconditioning vents were full of dust. There was algal growth on interior walls. Overall this hotel would be a health hazard, particularly for people who suffer from respiratory problems. Hotel was generally of a very poor standard. I would not contemplate staying there. Pay a bit more and stay elsewhere. We did !

Reviews.Title: “Not for the health concious”
Reviews.Author: Andrew86
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel (for approx 3 hours) in December 2004. If you want a modern, clean hotel, the garden hotel is not for you. This is a very old hotel which is destined for demolition, in fact the hotel was to be demolition in 2004. The rooms are large but they smell of mould. There are water stains on carpets and walls. carpets are torn, airconditioning vent in our room was full of fluff and dust. The shower screens were stained with mould. The hotel is a health hazard, particularly for people who suffer from respitory illnesses. Once we saw the state of this hotel and our rooms we immediately checked out. I could not stay in this hotel.
